question: I am  a 38 yr old female who has MS and has been treated for it with methylprednisalone.  About 6 months ago I was diagnosed with steroid induced diabetes.  Around the same time, I had acute rt sided abdominal pain along with severe nausea, vomiting, diahhrea and pruritus.  Several tests were done and I was told that I have a 3.5cm gallstone and fatty liver.  I have not improved from June to now.  A surgeon has recommended cholecystectomy.  My concern is how can I be sure that I do not have gallbladder and bile duct cancer versus a simple gallstone as there is family history of cancer. The suregeon states that it is very rare and I am too young.
title: new discovery fatty liver/gallstone/steroid induced diabetes
